p: The possible carrier agents for low doses of EOs are researched by industries in order to improve the quality of their final products. Actually, many applicable methods have been developed to encapsulate EOs and improve their stability [ 46]. Nanoemulsions, liposomes and solid-lipid NPs are currently used strategies for protection of plant BACs [ 3]. Furthermore, essential and fish oils can exert unpleasant flavors, which limits their direct inclusion into food formulations, due to their negative impact on the sensory quality. In this sense, nanoencapsulation is useful for masking unwanted flavors [ 69]. Considering all the above mentioned, nanoencapsulation is presented as a suitable technique for protecting EOs from evaporation and oxidation, showing prolonged activity for encapsulated BACs by a controlled liberation.
